title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act is titled the "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" and amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a section for the 15th-anniversary review agreement. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. Funding provisions include infrastructure maintenance and a fiscal consolidation fund. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, includes funding provisions for infrastructure projects and a fiscal consolidation fund. Congress consents to amendments to the Compact subsidiary agreements, and there is an authorization of appropriations for the agreement. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 authorizes appropriations for postal services related to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands until 2024. Appropriations to Federal entities under the Compact may continue through 2024 for specified purposes. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 authorizes appropriations for postal services related to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands until 2024. Appropriations for specified purposes may continue through 2024 and remain available until expended. Congressional oversight and reporting on Palau's eligibility for certain U.S. domestic programs are required. The Secretary must submit an annual report to specific Senate and House committees on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided to Palau under U.S. domestic programs. The Secretary must consult with relevant Federal agencies when preparing these reports. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeal of prior authorization for civil administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and limitation on use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. SEC. 136. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. None of the funds for global health activities from fiscal year 2012 to 2024 can be used for assistance to China. The total amount for global health activities is reduced by $2,000,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted later. The funds for climate change activities from fiscal year 2012 to 2024 cannot be used to assist China. The total amount for these activities is reduced by $4,500,000 each fiscal year. This restriction applies despite any other laws enacted later. Additionally, funds for the Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) program or any successor program cannot be used by the United States Agency for International Development for fiscal years 2012 and 2013. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to limit funds for IMET activities, with a reduction of $4,500,000 each fiscal year. This restriction applies despite any other laws enacted later. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to reduce funds for IMET activities by $4,500,000 each fiscal year, regardless of any subsequent laws enacted. "SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS." "Limitation on funds for United States contributions to the United Nations and United States Institute of Peace from fiscal year 2012 to 2024. Funds for UNESCO are prohibited, and there are reductions in the total amount that can be obligated for each fiscal year." The total amount available for United States contributions to the United Nations and United States Institute of Peace from fiscal year 2012 to 2024 is reduced by $6,811,000. This reduction applies regardless of any other laws enacted after this provision.
